alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 11:52AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected and the Mullen Fire Burn Scar. * WHERE...Portions of south central Wyoming and southeast Wyoming, including the following counties, in south central Wyoming, Carbon. In southeast Wyoming, Albany. Mullen and Cottonwood Creek will also be affected. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1148 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Carbon and Southwestern Albany Counties. This includes the northern portion of the Mullen Burn Scar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Stay Tuned to further updates and possible Flash Flood Warnings.
